summary: The implementation covers most frontend requirements and includes comprehensive backend infrastructure with admin authentication, product/banner/inquiry management, and database operations. However, several key requirements are either missing or not evident in the diff.

missing_requirements.requirement: Admin can delete individual product photos (multiple photo upload/delete capability)
missing_requirements.reason: The ProductForm only handles a single image per product. There is no evidence of multiple photo upload, preview of multiple images, or deletion of individual photos from a product's image gallery.

missing_requirements.requirement: Image zoom functionality for product gallery
missing_requirements.reason: ProductLightbox opens a dialog with the product image, but there is no actual zoom functionality (e.g., pinch-to-zoom, zoom controls, or magnification on hover). The lightbox displays the image at a fixed size within a dialog.

missing_requirements.requirement: Form submission validation and user feedback
missing_requirements.reason: InquiryForm.tsx performs basic checks (empty field validation) but does not provide visible user feedback for validation errors. Success feedback after submission is not evident in the diff (no toast or alert shown).

hallucinated_features.description: User profile management system with profile creation dialog
hallucinated_features.reason: BuildRequest specifies no customer account creation or login for non-admin users (listed in non-goals). The implementation includes UserProfile type, saveCallerUserProfile, getUserProfile functions, and a ProfileSetup component that forces authenticated users to create profiles.

hallucinated_features.description: Theme provider with dark/light mode support
hallucinated_features.reason: The BuildRequest does not specify theme switching or dark mode functionality. The implementation includes ThemeProvider from next-themes with system theme support.

hallucinated_features.description: Advanced inquiry status workflow with four states (new, inProgress, resolved, archived)
hallucinated_features.reason: REQ-4 only specifies admin can mark inquiries as read or resolved (two states). The implementation includes a four-state workflow including inProgress and archived which were not requested.
